title: Periodic waves - lambda and v when f2 gtr than f1

content.description: Two periodic waves, Wave <math alttext="1" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>1</mn></math> and Wave <math alttext="2" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>2</mn></math>, are propagating along the same long string. Wave <math alttext="1" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>1</mn></math> has a wavelength <math alttext="lambda sub 1" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>λ</mi><mn>1</mn></msub></math> and propagates along the string at speed <math alttext="v sub 1" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>v</mi><mn>1</mn></msub></math>. Wave <math alttext="2" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>2</mn></math>, which has a higher frequency than Wave <math alttext="1" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>1</mn></math>, has a wavelength <math alttext="lambda sub 2" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>λ</mi><mn>2</mn></msub></math> and propagates along the string at speed <math alttext="v sub 2" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>v</mi><mn>2</mn></msub></math>. Which of the following correctly compares <math alttext="lambda sub 1" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>λ</mi><mn>1</mn></msub></math> to <math alttext="lambda sub 2" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>λ</mi><mn>2</mn></msub></math> and <math alttext="v sub 1" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>v</mi><mn>1</mn></msub></math> to <math alttext="v sub 2" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>v</mi><mn>2</mn></msub></math>?
content.question: WavelengthSpeedA<math alttext="lambda sub 1, end sub, equals, lambda sub 2, end sub" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>λ</mi><mn>1</mn></msub><mo>=</mo><msub><mi>λ</mi><mn>2</mn></msub></math><math alttext="v sub 1, end sub, equals, v sub 2, end sub" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle displaystyle="true"><msub><mi>v</mi><mn>1</mn></msub><mo>=</mo><msub><mi>v</mi><mn>2</mn></msub></mstyle></math>B<math alttext="lambda sub 1, end sub, equals, lambda sub 2, end sub" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle displaystyle="true"><msub><mi>λ</mi><mn>1</mn></msub><mo>=</mo><msub><mi>λ</mi><mn>2</mn></msub></mstyle></math><math alttext="v sub 1, end sub, is less than, v sub 2, end sub" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle displaystyle="true"><msub><mi>v</mi><mn>1</mn></msub><mo><</mo><msub><mi>v</mi><mn>2</mn></msub></mstyle></math>C<math alttext="lambda sub 1, end sub, is greater than, lambda sub 2, end sub" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle displaystyle="true"><msub><mi>λ</mi><mn>1</mn></msub><mo>></mo><msub><mi>λ</mi><mn>2</mn></msub></mstyle></math><math alttext="v sub 1, end sub, equals, v sub 2, end sub" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle displaystyle="true"><msub><mi>v</mi><mn>1</mn></msub><mo>=</mo><msub><mi>v</mi><mn>2</mn></msub></mstyle></math>D<math alttext="lambda sub 1, end sub, is greater than, lambda sub 2, end sub" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle displaystyle="true"><msub><mi>λ</mi><mn>1</mn></msub><mo>></mo><msub><mi>λ</mi><mn>2</mn></msub></mstyle></math><math alttext="v sub 1, end sub, is less than, v sub 2, end sub" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle displaystyle="true"><msub><mi>v</mi><mn>1</mn></msub><mo><</mo><msub><mi>v</mi><mn>2</mn></msub></mstyle></math>

skill.text: 2.C: Compare physical quantities between two or more scenarios or at different times and locations in a single scenario.
